intro: Cosmos mcvaughii, commonly known as the desert cosmos, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and are surrounded by narrow, pale green bracts. The plant has hairy, silver-gray leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well-suited for xeriscaping. Cosmos mcvaughii is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
